31ad5d8f-1080-4e46-89c4-59939a4d586c.name: Agri-Food Supply Chain Finance and Risk Management
31ad5d8f-1080-4e46-89c4-59939a4d586c.name_en: Agri-Food Supply Chain Finance and Risk Management
31ad5d8f-1080-4e46-89c4-59939a4d586c.description:
Agri-Food Supply Chain Finance and Risk Management is a critical business skill focused on optimizing financial flows, managing credit, and mitigating risks within the interconnected networks that move agricultural products from farm to consumer. This skill encompasses the application of financial instruments, risk assessment methodologies, and strategic decision-making to ensure liquidity, solvency, and resilience across the agri-food value chain. Professionals in this area must understand the unique characteristics of agri-food supply chains, such as seasonality, perishability, price volatility, and the influence of global trade dynamics. They leverage tools like supply chain financing, invoice discounting, insurance products, and hedging strategies to address challenges such as delayed payments, market fluctuations, and disruptions from weather or geopolitical events. The skill is immediately relevant today as agri-food supply chains face increasing complexity due to globalization, regulatory changes, and sustainability pressures. Effective practitioners collaborate with producers, processors, distributors, and financial institutions to structure financing solutions that reduce working capital constraints, improve cash flow, and enhance risk-sharing. Use cases include structuring trade credit for smallholder farmers, implementing crop insurance programs, and deploying blockchain for transparent transaction tracking. Mastery of this skill enables organizations to maintain stable operations, support food security, and achieve competitive advantage in a rapidly evolving business landscape.

c4bdade1-94bd-477b-b82a-66534de14428.name: Agri-Food Supply Chain Risk Assessment
c4bdade1-94bd-477b-b82a-66534de14428.description:
Agri-Food Supply Chain Risk Assessment is a critical business skill focused on the identification, evaluation, and mitigation of risks that threaten the integrity, efficiency, and sustainability of agri-food supply chains. This skill is highly relevant in today's globalized and volatile environment, where agri-food supply chains face a multitude of risks including climate change, geopolitical instability, regulatory shifts, food safety incidents, supply disruptions, and market volatility. Practitioners must systematically analyze each link in the supply chain—from primary production and processing to distribution and retail—using both qualitative and quantitative methods to map vulnerabilities and assess the likelihood and impact of various risk scenarios. The skill involves the application of risk management frameworks, scenario planning, and real-time data analytics to anticipate disruptions, ensure compliance with food safety and traceability standards, and maintain business continuity. Effective agri-food supply chain risk assessment enables organizations to proactively develop contingency plans, diversify sourcing, optimize inventory, and strengthen supplier relationships. It is essential for ensuring food security, protecting brand reputation, and meeting consumer expectations for safe, reliable, and sustainable food products. This skill is immediately valuable for supply chain managers, risk analysts, procurement professionals, and business leaders operating in the agri-food sector, as it directly supports operational resilience and strategic decision-making in a rapidly changing business landscape.

fef3c091-0620-469a-9a0c-e0fccce2a3e4.name: Agri-Food Supply Chain Sustainability Reporting
fef3c091-0620-469a-9a0c-e0fccce2a3e4.description:
Agri-Food Supply Chain Sustainability Reporting is the business-critical skill of systematically collecting, analyzing, and communicating data on the environmental, social, and economic impacts of activities across the agri-food supply chain. This skill encompasses the ability to identify relevant sustainability metrics—such as greenhouse gas emissions, water usage, biodiversity impact, labor practices, and ethical sourcing—at each stage from farm production to processing, distribution, and retail. Practitioners must be adept at applying international frameworks (e.g., GRI, SASB, TCFD), adhering to regulatory requirements, and aligning with stakeholder expectations, including those of investors, customers, and governmental bodies. The skill involves integrating data from diverse sources, ensuring data accuracy and traceability, and presenting findings in clear, actionable reports that support transparency and informed decision-making. In today's business environment, this skill is vital for agri-food companies seeking to demonstrate accountability, manage risks, and maintain market access in response to increasing regulatory scrutiny and consumer demand for sustainable practices. Typical use cases include preparing annual sustainability reports, responding to ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) disclosure requests, and supporting supply chain partners in meeting sustainability standards. Mastery of this skill enables organizations to build trust, achieve compliance, and drive continuous improvement in sustainability performance throughout the agri-food value chain.

a2d27c6c-43dc-4368-b969-be6e69d18918.name: Amazon Aurora
a2d27c6c-43dc-4368-b969-be6e69d18918.description:
Amazon Aurora (Aurora) is a fully managed relational database engine that's compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL. You already know how MySQL and PostgreSQL combine the speed and reliability of high-end commercial databases with the simplicity and cost-effectiveness of open-source databases. The code, tools, and applications you use today with your existing MySQL and PostgreSQL databases can be used with Aurora. With some workloads, Aurora can deliver up to five times the throughput of MySQL and up to three times the throughput of PostgreSQL without requiring changes to most of your existing applications.

Aurora includes a high-performance storage subsystem. Its MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible database engines are customized to take advantage of that fast distributed storage. The underlying storage grows automatically as needed. An Aurora cluster volume can grow to a maximum size of 128 tebibytes (TiB). Aurora also automates and standardizes database clustering and replication, which are typically among the most challenging aspects of database configuration and administration.

Aurora is part of the managed database service Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS). Amazon RDS is a web service that makes it easier to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud.

cc94cbb9-cc20-49bc-aa47-54ef25ba0b5e.name: Amazon CloudWatch
cc94cbb9-cc20-49bc-aa47-54ef25ba0b5e.description:
Amazon CloudWatch monitors your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources and the applications you run on AWS in real time. You can use CloudWatch to collect and track metrics, which are variables you can measure for your resources and applications.

The CloudWatch home page automatically displays metrics about every AWS service you use. You can additionally create custom dashboards to display metrics about your custom applications, and display custom collections of metrics that you choose.

You can create alarms that watch metrics and send notifications or automatically make changes to the resources you are monitoring when a threshold is breached. For example, you can monitor the CPU usage and disk reads and writes of your Amazon EC2 instances and then use that data to determine whether you should launch additional instances to handle increased load. You can also use this data to stop under-used instances to save money.

With CloudWatch, you gain system-wide visibility into resource utilization, application performance, and operational health.

7073ff69-d538-4844-a55c-ab29aef2b0a5.name: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)
7073ff69-d538-4844-a55c-ab29aef2b0a5.description: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) provides scalable computing capacity in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud. Using Amazon EC2 eliminates your need to invest in hardware up front, so you can develop and deploy applications faster. You can use Amazon EC2 to launch as many or as few virtual servers as you need, configure security and networking, and manage storage. Amazon EC2 enables you to scale up or down to handle changes in requirements or spikes in popularity, reducing your need to forecast traffic.

7ea98ed1-15c0-486a-bf6a-7d6d1d5a6a42.name: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS)
7ea98ed1-15c0-486a-bf6a-7d6d1d5a6a42.description: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) is a fully managed container orchestration service that simplifies your deployment, management, and scaling of containerized applications. Simply describe your application and the resources required, and Amazon ECS will launch, monitor, and scale your application across flexible compute options with automatic integrations to other supporting AWS services that your application needs. Perform system operations such as creating custom scaling and capacity rules, and observe and query data from application logs and telemetry.

0c3facfd-e46f-48c3-be3a-31decad35453.name: Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)
0c3facfd-e46f-48c3-be3a-31decad35453.description:
Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) is a managed SQL database service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). Amazon RDS supports an array of database engines to store and organize data. It also helps with relational database management tasks, such as data migration, backup, recovery and patching.

Amazon RDS facilitates the deployment and maintenance of relational databases in the cloud. A cloud administrator uses Amazon RDS to set up, operate, manage and scale a relational instance of a cloud database. Amazon RDS is not itself a database; it is a service used to manage relational databases.

71013ad8-8c48-4f48-8f05-bfce7a9218dd.name: Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS)
71013ad8-8c48-4f48-8f05-bfce7a9218dd.description: Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) is a managed service that provides message delivery from publishers to subscribers (also known as producers and consumers). Publishers communicate asynchronously with subscribers by sending messages to a topic, which is a logical access point and communication channel. Clients can subscribe to the SNS topic and receive published messages using a supported endpoint type, such as Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose, Amazon SQS, AWS Lambda, HTTP, email, mobile push notifications, and mobile text messages (SMS).

d4d8f3af-3231-4ab2-a579-db5b6ed3afc0.name: Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS)
d4d8f3af-3231-4ab2-a579-db5b6ed3afc0.description:
Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a fully managed message queuing service that enables you to decouple and scale microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications. SQS eliminates the complexity and overhead associated with managing and operating message-oriented middleware, and empowers developers to focus on differentiating work. Using SQS, you can send, store, and receive messages between software components at any volume, without losing messages or requiring other services to be available. Get started with SQS in minutes using the AWS Management Console, Command Line Interface or SDK of your choice, and three simple commands.

SQS offers two types of message queues. Standard queues offer maximum throughput, best-effort ordering, and at-least-once delivery. SQS FIFO queues are designed to guarantee that messages are processed exactly once, in the exact order that they are sent.

75c69f17-b7dc-41b9-a338-39d91a33ad04.name: Anaconda
75c69f17-b7dc-41b9-a338-39d91a33ad04.description: Anaconda is an open-source distribution of the Python and R programming languages for data science that aims to simplify package management and deployment. Package versions in Anaconda are managed by the package management system, conda, which analyzes the current environment before executing an installation to avoid disrupting other frameworks and packages.

d73248f8-165c-4474-b7ad-1d4f0738ec1c.name: Analytical
d73248f8-165c-4474-b7ad-1d4f0738ec1c.description: Analytical personalities require time to do well and they embrace problems that require extensive research or examination; they are process-driven and are adept at breaking down large, complex issues. Deep and thoughtful, analytical personalities value facts, data, reasoning and clear communication.

33648f97-fa84-450f-a8f6-dd74e09773a8.name: Anti-corruption and bribery compliance
33648f97-fa84-450f-a8f6-dd74e09773a8.description: That makes anti-bribery and corruption equally essential parts of your compliance programs. Anti-bribery guidelines prevent people and organizations from attempting to bribe others, while anti-corruption guidelines prevent public officials from accepting those bribes.

c0d3dce2-d927-458b-86ea-692ae99757b9.name: Apache Camel
c0d3dce2-d927-458b-86ea-692ae99757b9.description: Apache Camel is an open-source framework for building enterprise integration patterns (EIPs) and routing messages between different software systems. It provides a rule-based routing and mediation engine that allows you to define routing and processing rules in domain-specific languages, such as Java, XML, or Groovy.

e70660f7-e97e-49ae-9ad7-a8242dc5cf5e.name: Apache JMeter
e70660f7-e97e-49ae-9ad7-a8242dc5cf5e.description: Apache JMeter is a testing tool used for analyzing and measuring the performance of different software services and products. It is a pure Java open source software used for testing Web Application or FTP application. It is used to execute performance testing, load testing and functional testing of web applications.

19576fee-55f4-4cfd-85d2-42e04dc54d03.name: Apache Kafka
19576fee-55f4-4cfd-85d2-42e04dc54d03.description: Apache Kafka is a distributed data store optimized for ingesting and processing streaming data in real-time. Streaming data is data that is continuously generated by thousands of data sources, which typically send the data records in simultaneously.

29a1fb46-9e68-4258-bdd7-caaba3e9406a.name: Apex Programming
29a1fb46-9e68-4258-bdd7-caaba3e9406a.description: Apex is a strongly typed language that uses direct references to schema objects such as object and field names. It fails quickly at compile time if any references are invalid. It stores all custom field, object, and class dependencies in metadata to ensure that they are not deleted while required by active Apex code.

d59ee568-4f61-4764-9e28-793f389b8c45.name: Appium
d59ee568-4f61-4764-9e28-793f389b8c45.description: Appium is an open source automation tool for running scripts and testing native applications, mobile-web applications and hybrid applications on Android or iOS using a webdriver.

b201efc7-83f6-42ac-baa4-7129d7715c14.name: Application logging
b201efc7-83f6-42ac-baa4-7129d7715c14.description: Application logging is a critical part of log management and can help keep your business running smoothly and securely. Application logging is the process of saving application events. With this information in hand, tech pros can assess threats and analyze errors before they disrupt broader business workflows.

a9f59a96-ce7d-4b5a-8beb-051d3f94d443.name: Aqua IDE
a9f59a96-ce7d-4b5a-8beb-051d3f94d443.description: Aqua is the first IDE created specifically for test automation. It's an all-in-one workspace that supports Selenium, Cypress, and Playwright. Aqua is a polyglot IDE that understands Java, Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Kotlin, and SQL.

4989a2e6-f013-4e54-81db-605072deb118.name: Artificial intelligence
4989a2e6-f013-4e54-81db-605072deb118.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the intelligence of machines or software, as opposed to the intelligence of humans or animals. It is also the field of study in computer science that develops and studies intelligent machines. "AI" may also refer to the machines themselves.

5d5ae9f4-1259-495b-b71c-1040d2987a0d.name: Artistic ability
5d5ae9f4-1259-495b-b71c-1040d2987a0d.description: By definition, artistry and artistic ability is the cultivation of skills and talents honed toward creating fine works of art: painting, drawing, sculpting, musical composition

5ed80048-8923-40a4-b333-f8e68c4e4441.name: Asprise OCR
5ed80048-8923-40a4-b333-f8e68c4e4441.description: Asprise OCR is a commercial optical character recognition and barcode recognition SDK library that provides an API to recognize text as well as barcodes from images (in formats like JPEG, PNG, TIFF, PDF, etc.) and output in formats like plain text, xml and searchable PDF.

5f41359f-7ce1-4c31-a83e-7fa28208e189.name: Asymmetric encryption (RSA)
5f41359f-7ce1-4c31-a83e-7fa28208e189.description: Asymmetric encryption uses two keys (public and private) and is slower, as it requires complex mathematical operations.

458532f8-708e-4a9e-b245-59eb3a920cbe.name: Atlassian Bamboo
458532f8-708e-4a9e-b245-59eb3a920cbe.description: Atlassian Bamboo is a continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) server. Bamboo assists software development teams by providing: automated building and testing of software source-code status.

bb59bcdf-609f-403b-9899-1c2dddf1a1d5.name: Audio editing software
bb59bcdf-609f-403b-9899-1c2dddf1a1d5.description: Audio editing software is any software or computer program which allows editing and generating audio data. Audio editing software can be implemented completely or partly as a library, as a computer application, as a web application, or as a loadable kernel module. Wave editors are digital audio editors.

de7a8b2e-8f39-417c-8a5e-dd91711a8718.name: Audit Compliance
de7a8b2e-8f39-417c-8a5e-dd91711a8718.description: The independent assessment of whether a given subject matter is in. compliance with applicable authorities identified as criteria. Compliance audits are carried out. by assessing whether activities, financial transactions and information comply in all material.

0d5ac1c9-4d06-4cbc-a56b-20e63a6da86f.name: Audit engagement
0d5ac1c9-4d06-4cbc-a56b-20e63a6da86f.description: An audit engagement is an agreement between a client and an independent third-party auditor to perform an audit of some element of the client's business, such as accounting records, financial statements, internal controls, regulatory compliance, information systems, operational processes, etc

2bf35c0b-7c64-43a2-85c5-f285c54526aa.name: Auditing and Assurance Standards
2bf35c0b-7c64-43a2-85c5-f285c54526aa.description: Auditing standards are authoritative standards that help auditors perform high-quality work with close attention to consistency and transparency. Auditing standards support the credibility of auditors and the auditing process – as well as the reliability of financial statements.

e4b92881-ed92-4947-acd8-1d7fe458f1c8.name: Autodesk BIM 360 Glue
e4b92881-ed92-4947-acd8-1d7fe458f1c8.description: Autodesk® BIM 360™ Glue is a cloud-based BIM management and collaboration product that connects the entire project team and streamlines BIM project workflows.

82a3a321-2daf-4e1e-b450-9996e3157b53.name: Automated Incident Analysis with AI
82a3a321-2daf-4e1e-b450-9996e3157b53.description:
Automated Incident Analysis with AI is a critical technical skill that leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to detect, analyze, and prioritize security incidents in real time. This skill encompasses the configuration, deployment, and management of AI-driven systems that process vast volumes of security data—such as logs, alerts, and network traffic—to identify threats, anomalies, and potential breaches with greater speed and accuracy than manual methods. Practitioners must understand how to integrate AI models with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) platforms, orchestrate automated workflows, and interpret AI-generated insights to support rapid incident response. Key competencies include knowledge of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms for anomaly detection, natural language processing for threat intelligence parsing, and the use of automation tools like SOAR (Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response) platforms. Immediate applications include triaging alerts, reducing false positives, correlating disparate data sources, and providing actionable recommendations to security teams. This skill is currently essential for minimizing the dwell time of attackers, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and enabling organizations to respond to threats at machine speed. It also requires awareness of AI explainability, model drift, and the need for continuous tuning to adapt to evolving attack techniques. Automated Incident Analysis with AI is foundational for modern security operations centers (SOCs) and is increasingly expected in technical security roles due to the growing sophistication and volume of cyber threats.

ad101136-5bf6-4796-b2fe-55d139363eda.name: Automated Sustainability Data Collection and Integration
ad101136-5bf6-4796-b2fe-55d139363eda.name_en: Automated Sustainability Data Collection and Integration
ad101136-5bf6-4796-b2fe-55d139363eda.description:
Automated Sustainability Data Collection and Integration is a critical technical skill focused on the design, deployment, and management of systems that automatically gather, process, and consolidate sustainability-related data from diverse sources in real time. This skill encompasses the use of IoT sensors, APIs, data pipelines, and integration platforms to capture metrics such as energy consumption, greenhouse gas emissions, water usage, waste generation, and supply chain sustainability indicators. Practitioners must ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness, often leveraging ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, data normalization techniques, and interoperability standards (e.g., GRI, CDP, SASB) to enable seamless aggregation and reporting. The skill is essential for organizations aiming to comply with evolving environmental regulations, meet ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) disclosure requirements, and provide transparent, auditable data to stakeholders. Immediate applications include automating sustainability dashboards, supporting real-time compliance monitoring, and enabling data-driven decision-making for sustainability initiatives. Mastery of this skill requires familiarity with cloud-based data integration tools, data governance practices, and secure data transmission protocols. It also involves collaboration with sustainability officers, IT teams, and external partners to ensure that automated data flows align with organizational goals and reporting frameworks. In today's regulatory and stakeholder environment, this skill is indispensable for organizations seeking operational efficiency, risk mitigation, and enhanced sustainability performance.

27c61be3-92dd-4d08-a9c5-2dd3e607d0bc.name: Azure AI
27c61be3-92dd-4d08-a9c5-2dd3e607d0bc.description: Azure AI services are a suite of cloud-based artificial intelligence (AI) services that help developers and organizations create intelligent, cutting-edge, market-ready, and responsible applications with out-of-the-box and pre-built tools, APIs, and models. These services are designed to help modernize business processes faster and build responsible AI solutions to deploy at market speed. Azure AI services are available through REST APIs and client library SDKs in popular development languages.

1237df2d-0437-4d06-b02f-d0d64de2d8bf.name: Azure API Management
1237df2d-0437-4d06-b02f-d0d64de2d8bf.description: Azure API Management is a hybrid, multicloud management platform for APIs across all environments. As a platform-as-a-service, API Management supports the complete API lifecycle. Tip. If you're already familiar with API Management and ready to start, see these resources: Features and service tiers.

24ab3c64-8bba-4f5b-97c9-3850ff2dba9e.name: Azure App Services
24ab3c64-8bba-4f5b-97c9-3850ff2dba9e.description:
Azure App Service is an HTTP-based service for hosting web applications, REST APIs, and mobile back ends. You can develop in your favorite language, be it .NET, .NET Core, Java, Node.js, Python, or PHP. Applications run and scale with ease on both Windows and Linux-based environments.

App Service adds the power of Microsoft Azure to your application, including improved security, load balancing, autoscaling, and automated management. Additionally, you can take advantage of its DevOps capabilities, such as continuous deployment from Azure DevOps, GitHub, Docker Hub, and other sources, package management, staging environments, custom domains, and TLS/SSL certificates.

bd38a5b1-3b36-4fef-a268-3c514bcd9444.name: Azure Blob Storage
bd38a5b1-3b36-4fef-a268-3c514bcd9444.description: Azure Blob Storage is Microsoft's object storage solution for the cloud. Blob Storage is optimized for storing massive amounts of unstructured data. Unstructured data is data that doesn't adhere to a particular data model or definition, such as text or binary data.

033739ad-d117-46d1-a8b1-7c9f163a9c38.name: Azure Compute
033739ad-d117-46d1-a8b1-7c9f163a9c38.description: Azure Compute is a set of cloud computing services provided by Microsoft Azure that offer scalable and flexible solutions for running applications and workloads in the cloud. It provides services such as virtual machines, containers, serverless computing, and batch processing to meet a wide range of computing demands.

64a71510-a91f-48da-b584-0268b8a95c7a.name: Azure Cosmos DB
64a71510-a91f-48da-b584-0268b8a95c7a.description: Azure Cosmos DB is a fully managed NoSQL, relational, and vector database. It offers single-digit millisecond response times, automatic and instant scalability, along with guaranteed speed at any scale.

5294c97f-6536-4b41-833d-07bc1bd9530d.name: Azure Data Factory
5294c97f-6536-4b41-833d-07bc1bd9530d.description: It is the cloud-based ETL and data integration service that allows you to create data-driven workflows for orchestrating data movement and transforming data at scale. Using Azure Data Factory, you can create and schedule data-driven workflows (called pipelines) that can ingest data from disparate data stores.

cae44cf6-3dfd-4f09-85af-60442762ab7b.name: Azure DevOps Release management
cae44cf6-3dfd-4f09-85af-60442762ab7b.description: Release Management is a service in Azure DevOps Services that helps you automate the deployment and testing of your software in multiple environments. Using Release Management, you can either fully automate the delivery of your software all the way to production, or set up semi-automated processes with approvals and on-demand deployments. It is an essential element of DevOps that helps your team continuously deliver software to your customers at a faster pace and with lower risk, as well as improving efficiency and collaboration between the teams that participate in release processes.

f00831fe-b323-40eb-bc9b-867f3c9534d1.name: Azure DevOps
f00831fe-b323-40eb-bc9b-867f3c9534d1.description: Azure DevOps is an end-to-end software development platform that offers an assortment of capabilities intended to organize and accelerate development efforts across the entire application lifecycle: Requirements management. Project management for both Agile software development and waterfall teams.

9fc78555-eee8-448a-95a3-69a935c25365.name: Azure Express Route
9fc78555-eee8-448a-95a3-69a935c25365.description: Extend your on-premises networks to the Microsoft cloud over a private connection with the help of a connectivity provider. ExpressRoute connections don't route through the public internet, providing users with more reliability, faster speeds, consistent latency, and higher security.

b5a3675a-1193-4844-b739-c1b26eb454dc.name: Azure Files
b5a3675a-1193-4844-b739-c1b26eb454dc.description: An Azure file share is a convenient place for cloud applications to write their logs, metrics, and crash dumps. Logs can be written by the application instances via the File REST API, and developers can access them by mounting the file share on their local machine.

9044933e-a228-4f69-8858-d8cb0e1ad160.name: Azure Functions
9044933e-a228-4f69-8858-d8cb0e1ad160.description:
Azure Functions is a serverless solution that allows you to write less code, maintain less infrastructure, and save on costs. Instead of worrying about deploying and maintaining servers, the cloud infrastructure provides all the up-to-date resources needed to keep your applications running.

You focus on the code that matters most to you, in the most productive language for you, and Azure Functions handles the rest.

04279e15-559c-4b12-843b-9c131753ccba.name: Azure Key Vault
04279e15-559c-4b12-843b-9c131753ccba.description: Azure Key Vault is a cloud service for securely storing and accessing secrets. A secret is anything that you want to tightly control access to, such as API keys, passwords, certificates, or cryptographic keys. Key Vault service supports two types of containers: vaults and managed hardware security module(HSM) pools.

ba24e3c9-8ed0-4d4c-9f7b-1c96a0f79ee7.name: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
ba24e3c9-8ed0-4d4c-9f7b-1c96a0f79ee7.description: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) is a fully managed Kubernetes service that simplifies cluster management and reduces operational overhead. It offers autoscaling for seamless application scaling, enterprise-grade security features, and integration with popular development tools and CI/CD pipelines.

d8761bb0-54fb-4fe6-bffe-bfc080f260b3.name: Azure Load Balancer
d8761bb0-54fb-4fe6-bffe-bfc080f260b3.description:
The Azure load balancer manages outbound and inbound connections and users can manage service availability with TCP and HTTP health-probing options, defining rules to map inbound connections to back-end pool destinations and configuring public and internal load-balanced endpoints. 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/load-balancer/load-balancer-overview

a48681c3-c480-4ed0-beac-7492a03f259e.name: Azure Machine Learning
a48681c3-c480-4ed0-beac-7492a03f259e.description: Azure Machine Learning is a comprehensive machine learning platform that supports language model fine-tuning and deployment. Using the Azure Machine Learning model catalog, users can create an endpoint for Azure OpenAI Service and use RESI APIs to integrate models into applications

fa205aef-c39f-48fc-bff2-3576d9d790ee.name: Azure Migrate
fa205aef-c39f-48fc-bff2-3576d9d790ee.description: Azure Migrate is a Microsoft service that helps an enterprise assess how its on-premises workloads will perform, and how much they will cost to host, in the Azure public cloud. While Azure Migrate helps with planning a cloud migration, it does not actually transfer on-premises virtual machines (VMs) to the Azure cloud.

f1f0548b-6ac3-4819-9556-4892591a7f31.name: Azure Networking
f1f0548b-6ac3-4819-9556-4892591a7f31.description:
Azure Virtual Network Manager is a management service that enables you to group, configure, deploy, and manage virtual networks globally across subscriptions. With Virtual Network Manager, you can define network groups to identify and logically segment your virtual networks.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/networking/fundamentals/networking-overview

9cdc02ae-a0e8-47d3-ac91-5c97b93782d9.name: Azure PowerShell
9cdc02ae-a0e8-47d3-ac91-5c97b93782d9.description: Azure PowerShell is a powerful tool for managing and administering Azure resources directly from PowerShell. It's ideal for building automated workflows and managing resources using the Azure Resource Manager model. You can try it out in your browser using Azure Cloud Shell or install it locally on your machine.

642b4e43-f5b6-4d1a-9c99-1be3e8d4906c.name: Azure Queue Storage
642b4e43-f5b6-4d1a-9c99-1be3e8d4906c.description: Azure Queue Storage is a service for storing large numbers of messages. You access messages from anywhere in the world via authenticated calls using HTTP or HTTPS. A queue message can be up to 64 KB in size. A queue may contain millions of messages, up to the total capacity limit of a storage account.

41bc6e55-7474-4c9a-9c9f-a5bcd1d50140.name: Azure SQL
41bc6e55-7474-4c9a-9c9f-a5bcd1d50140.description: Part of the Azure SQL family, Azure SQL is a fully managed relational database service built for the Azure cloud. Build your next app with the assistance of a fully managed SQL database with built-in AI capabilities, auto-scaling, and backups.

f58dbe55-b8f7-4bd6-971f-7bbeea99b426.name: Azure Security Center
f58dbe55-b8f7-4bd6-971f-7bbeea99b426.description: Azure Security Center is a security management tool that allows you to gain insight into your security state across hybrid cloud workloads, reduce your exposure to attacks, and respond to detected threats quickly.

eb62575f-bf61-4c0f-b454-b371f00c124b.name: Azure Sentinel
eb62575f-bf61-4c0f-b454-b371f00c124b.description: Azure Sentinel, renamed to Microsoft Sentinel, is a cloud native security information and event management (SIEM) and security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR) solution that runs in the Azure cloud.

323a8146-4fe6-4f13-bcdf-b79a35ae700b.name: Azure Storage
323a8146-4fe6-4f13-bcdf-b79a35ae700b.description: The Azure Storage platform is Microsoft's cloud storage solution for modern data storage scenarios. Azure Storage offers highly available, massively scalable, durable, and secure storage for a variety of data objects in the cloud

463f93f5-b873-4fb6-9ca5-dd6546c346b8.name: Azure Synapse Analytics
463f93f5-b873-4fb6-9ca5-dd6546c346b8.description: Azure Synapse is a limitless analytics service that brings together enterprise data warehousing and Big Data analytics. It gives you the freedom to query data on your terms, using either serverless or dedicated resources—at scale.  Ref:  https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/synapse-analytics/

fcf94ad1-3479-4647-b600-b1690f77ee7b.name: Azure Table storage
fcf94ad1-3479-4647-b600-b1690f77ee7b.description: Azure Table storage is a service that stores large amounts of structured NoSQL data in the cloud, providing a key/attribute store with a schema-less design. Azure Cosmos DB provides a Table API for applications that are written for Azure Table storage that need premium capabilities like: Turnkey global distribution.

76a72a48-1ea0-4067-adf4-d10815f8b2bf.name: Azure VMware Solution (AVS)
76a72a48-1ea0-4067-adf4-d10815f8b2bf.description: Azure VMware Solution (AVS) is a native Azure service providing a VMware virtual private cloud software stack running on dedicated bare-metal servers in Azure regions.

87749ee5-dcb8-4e43-97d6-03b23c50db03.name: Azure VPN Gateway
87749ee5-dcb8-4e43-97d6-03b23c50db03.description: Azure VPN Gateway is a service that can be used to send encrypted traffic between an Azure virtual network and on-premises locations over the public Internet. You can also use VPN Gateway to send encrypted traffic between Azure virtual networks over the Microsoft network. VPN Gateway uses a specific type of Azure virtual network gateway called a VPN gateway. Multiple connections can be created to the same VPN gateway. When you create multiple connections, all VPN tunnels share the available gateway bandwidth.

f3a0e9b6-b0a6-4cbc-9d03-85895b9af363.name: Azure Virtual Desktop
f3a0e9b6-b0a6-4cbc-9d03-85895b9af363.description: Azure Virtual Desktop is a desktop and app virtualization service that runs on Azure.

7fda8a7a-9a3f-421d-9a2c-5bbed84ceda0.name: Azure Virtual Network
7fda8a7a-9a3f-421d-9a2c-5bbed84ceda0.description:
Azure Virtual Network is a service that provides the fundamental building block for your private network in Azure. An instance of the service (a virtual network) enables many types of Azure resources to securely communicate with each other, the internet, and on-premises networks.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview

d33ca71e-f4ed-4b2d-a7f3-bcd0d8fd86ad.name: Azure data lake
d33ca71e-f4ed-4b2d-a7f3-bcd0d8fd86ad.description: A data lake is a centralized repository that ingests, stores, and allows for processing of large volumes of data in its original form. It can accommodate all types of data, which is then used to power big data analytics, machine learning, and other forms of intelligent action.

13ac8661-cabe-447b-9ad7-2fe58abeed1b.name: Azure identity management security
13ac8661-cabe-447b-9ad7-2fe58abeed1b.description: Identity management is the process of authenticating and authorizing security principals. It also involves controlling information about those principals (identities). Security principals (identities) may include services, applications, users, groups, etc. Microsoft identity and access management solutions help IT protect access to applications and resources across the corporate datacenter and into the cloud. Such protection enables additional levels of validation, such as multifactor authentication and Conditional Access policies. Monitoring suspicious activity through advanced security reporting, auditing, and alerting helps mitigate potential security issues. Microsoft Entra ID P1 or P2 provides single sign-on (SSO) to thousands of cloud software as a service (SaaS) apps and access to web apps that you run on-premises.

069f0cae-3072-46c4-96f5-989cb8c793a1.name: Backlog grooming, or backlog refinement
069f0cae-3072-46c4-96f5-989cb8c793a1.description: Backlog grooming, or backlog refinement, is the regular updation of the product backlog. The key goal is to keep the backlog current and prep backlog items for future sprints

c5126317-064b-413f-ad8c-da1c6d8a05f6.name: Backstage
c5126317-064b-413f-ad8c-da1c6d8a05f6.description: Powered by a centralized software catalog, Backstage restores order to your infrastructure and enables your product teams to ship high-quality code quickly — without compromising autonomy.  Ref:  https://backstage.io/

c3856f8c-e4c6-4965-9f01-aa971304a84c.name: Backup
c3856f8c-e4c6-4965-9f01-aa971304a84c.description: Backup, or data backup is a copy of computer data taken and stored elsewhere so that it may be used to restore the original after a data loss event. The verb form, referring to the process of doing so, is "back up", whereas the noun and adjective form is "backup".

e0f40097-2564-4c0f-8932-5d8de428ed5f.name: Basecamp
e0f40097-2564-4c0f-8932-5d8de428ed5f.description: Basecamp's tool is a customizable team collaboration and project management platform that helps companies improve communication, improve process speed, and successfully deliver projects.

a5b7c293-b94f-4054-a10b-58b1dd27fe25.name: Bash scripting
a5b7c293-b94f-4054-a10b-58b1dd27fe25.description: A Bash script is a plain text file which contains a series of commands. These commands are a mixture of commands we would normally type ouselves on the command line (such as ls or cp for example) and commands we could type on the command line but generally wouldn't (you'll discover these over the next few pages).

191370ae-f441-46fa-834e-aa5a5ba5367d.name: Basic Framework
191370ae-f441-46fa-834e-aa5a5ba5367d.description: When it comes to software, a framework is like a blueprint for your application. It not only includes the core structure but also libraries and tools that can handle repetitive tasks, like database connections or user authentication.

c54cdf73-9ca3-459b-9844-936629ea52b6.name: Bias Detection and Mitigation in AI Systems
c54cdf73-9ca3-459b-9844-936629ea52b6.name_en: Bias Detection and Mitigation in AI Systems
c54cdf73-9ca3-459b-9844-936629ea52b6.description:
Bias Detection and Mitigation in AI Systems is the technical skill of systematically identifying, analyzing, and reducing unwanted biases in artificial intelligence models and their underlying data. This skill is crucial in today's landscape, where AI-driven decisions directly impact individuals and communities in areas such as hiring, lending, healthcare, law enforcement, and content moderation. Practitioners must be proficient in statistical analysis, algorithmic auditing, and the use of specialized tools (e.g., Fairness Indicators, IBM AI Fairness 360, What-If Tool) to uncover disparate impacts and measure fairness metrics such as demographic parity, equal opportunity, and disparate impact ratio. The skill encompasses understanding sources of bias—including data collection, labeling, and model selection—and applying mitigation strategies such as re-sampling, re-weighting, adversarial debiasing, and post-processing adjustments. It also involves integrating fairness constraints into model training and validating outcomes through rigorous testing and stakeholder feedback. Effective bias detection and mitigation require collaboration with domain experts, ethicists, and affected communities to ensure interventions are contextually appropriate and legally compliant. This skill is immediately relevant due to increasing regulatory scrutiny (e.g., EU AI Act, US EEOC guidance) and public demand for transparent, equitable AI systems. Mastery of this skill enables organizations to build trustworthy AI, reduce reputational and legal risks, and promote social responsibility in technology deployment.

c54cdf73-9ca3-459b-9844-936629ea52b6.description_en: Bias Detection and Mitigation in AI Systems is the technical skill of systematically identifying, analyzing, and reducing unwanted biases in artificial intelligence models and their underlying data. This skill is crucial in today's landscape, where AI-driven decisions directly impact individuals and communities in areas such as hiring, lending, healthcare, law enforcement, and content moderation. Practitioners must be proficient in statistical analysis, algorithmic auditing, and the use of specialized tools (e.g., Fairness Indicators, IBM AI Fairness 360, What-If Tool) to uncover disparate impacts and measure fairness metrics such as demographic parity, equal opportunity, and disparate impact ratio. The skill encompasses understanding sources of bias—including data collection, labeling, and model selection—and applying mitigation strategies such as re-sampling, re-weighting, adversarial debiasing, and post-processing adjustments. It also involves integrating fairness constraints into model training and validating outcomes through rigorous testing and stakeholder feedback. Effective bias detection and mitigation require collaboration with domain experts, ethicists, and affected communities to ensure interventions are contextually appropriate and legally compliant. This skill is immediately relevant due to increasing regulatory scrutiny (e.g., EU AI Act, US EEOC guidance) and public demand for transparent, equitable AI systems. Mastery of this skill enables organizations to build trustworthy AI, reduce reputational and legal risks, and promote social responsibility in technology deployment.

cdfc0bed-195a-4ecd-8266-397bfd6aa688.name: Big data
cdfc0bed-195a-4ecd-8266-397bfd6aa688.description:
Big data refers to data sets that are too large or complex to be dealt with by traditional data-processing application software. Data with many fields (rows) offer greater statistical power, while data with higher complexity (more attributes or columns) may lead to a higher false discovery rate.[2] Big data analysis challenges include capturing data, data storage, data analysis, search, sharing, transfer, visualization, querying, updating, information privacy, and data source. Big data was originally associated with three key concepts: volume, variety, and velocity.[3] The analysis of big data presents challenges in sampling, and thus previously allowing for only observations and sampling. Thus a fourth concept, veracity, refers to the quality or insightfulness of the data. Without sufficient investment in expertise for big data veracity, then the volume and variety of data can produce costs and risks that exceed an organization's capacity to create and capture value from big data.[4]

Current usage of the term big data tends to refer to the use of predictive analytics, user behavior analytics, or certain other advanced data analytics methods that extract value from big data, and seldom to a particular size of data set. "There is little doubt that the quantities of data now available are indeed large, but that's not the most relevant characteristic of this new data ecosystem."[5] Analysis of data sets can find new correlations to "spot business trends, prevent diseases, combat crime and so on".[6] Scientists, business executives, medical practitioners, advertising and governments alike regularly meet difficulties with large data-sets in areas including Internet searches, fintech, healthcare analytics, geographic information systems, urban informatics, and business informatics. Scientists encounter limitations in e-Science work, including meteorology, genomics,[7] connectomics, complex physics simulations, biology, and environmental research.[8]

The size and number of available data sets have grown rapidly as data is collected by devices such as mobile devices, cheap and numerous information-sensing Internet of things devices, aerial (remote sensing), software logs, cameras, microphones, radio-frequency identification (RFID) readers and wireless sensor networks.[9][10] The world's technological per-capita capacity to store information has roughly doubled every 40 months since the 1980s;[11] as of 2012, every day 2.5 exabytes (2.5×260 bytes) of data are generated.[12] Based on an IDC report prediction, the global data volume was predicted to grow exponentially from 4.4 zettabytes to 44 zettabytes between 2013 and 2020. By 2025, IDC predicts there will be 163 zettabytes of data.[13] According to IDC, global spending on big data and business analytics (BDA) solutions is estimated to reach $215.7 billion in 2021.[14][15] While Statista report, the global big data market is forecasted to grow to $103 billion by 2027.[16] In 2011 McKinsey & Company reported, if US healthcare were to use big data creatively and effectively to drive efficiency and quality, the sector could create more than $300 billion in value every year.[17] In the developed economies of Europe, government administrators could save more than €100 billion ($149 billion) in operational efficiency improvements alone by using big data.[17] And users of services enabled by personal-location data could capture $600 billion in consumer surplus.[17] One question for large enterprises is determining who should own big-data initiatives that affect the entire organization.[18]

Relational database management systems and desktop statistical software packages used to visualize data often have difficulty processing and analyzing big data. The processing and analysis of big data may require "massively parallel software running on tens, hundreds, or even thousands of servers".[19] What qualifies as "big data" varies depending on the capabilities of those analyzing it and their tools. Furthermore, expanding capabilities make big data a moving target. "For some organizations, facing hundreds of gigabytes of data for the first time may trigger a need to reconsider data management options. For others, it may take tens or hundreds of terabytes before data size becomes a significant consideration."

33230a16-c12f-482f-be4c-89d1b7dc6c4f.name: Blazor
33230a16-c12f-482f-be4c-89d1b7dc6c4f.description: Blazor is a modern front-end web framework based on HTML, CSS, and C# that helps you build web apps faster. With Blazor, build web apps using reusable components that can be run from both the client and the server so that you can deliver great web experiences.

e856cb7f-8914-4c98-9bec-0878e399b423.name: Blockchain for Food Supply Chain Transparency
e856cb7f-8914-4c98-9bec-0878e399b423.name_en: Blockchain for Food Supply Chain Transparency
e856cb7f-8914-4c98-9bec-0878e399b423.description:
Blockchain for Food Supply Chain Transparency is the application of distributed ledger technology to record, track, and verify every transaction and movement of food products throughout the supply chain in a secure, immutable, and transparent manner. This skill involves designing, implementing, and maintaining blockchain-based systems that capture critical data points—such as origin, processing, transportation, storage, and handling—at each stage of the food supply chain. By leveraging blockchain’s decentralized and tamper-evident architecture, professionals ensure that all stakeholders, from producers to retailers and consumers, have access to trustworthy, real-time information about food provenance, quality, and safety. This transparency is crucial for addressing pressing issues such as food fraud, contamination, recalls, and regulatory compliance. The skill requires a strong understanding of blockchain protocols (such as Ethereum or Hyperledger), smart contract development, data integration with IoT sensors, and interoperability with existing supply chain management systems. Typical use cases include tracing the source of contaminated products during a recall, verifying organic or fair-trade certifications, and providing consumers with verifiable product histories via QR codes. Mastery of this skill enables organizations to build consumer trust, reduce operational risks, and comply with increasingly stringent food safety regulations. In today’s environment, where food safety and authenticity are under intense scrutiny, this skill is immediately valuable and highly sought after in the technical domain.

0ee46112-d164-43dd-b11e-7ee3237b0a3c.name: Blockchain
0ee46112-d164-43dd-b11e-7ee3237b0a3c.description:
A blockchain is a distributed ledger with growing lists of records (blocks) that are securely linked together via cryptographic hashes. Each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data (generally represented as a Merkle tree, where data nodes are represented by leaves). Since each block contains information about the previous block, they effectively form a chain (compare linked list data structure), with each additional block linking to the ones before it. Consequently, blockchain transactions are irreversible in that, once they are recorded, the data in any given block cannot be altered retroactively without altering all subsequent blocks.

Blockchains are typically managed by a peer-to-peer (P2P) computer network for use as a public distributed ledger, where nodes collectively adhere to a consensus algorithm protocol to add and validate new transaction blocks. Although blockchain records are not unalterable, since blockchain forks are possible, blockchains may be considered secure by design and exemplify a distributed computing system with high Byzantine fault tolerance.

A blockchain was created by a person (or group of people) using the name (or pseudonym) Satoshi Nakamoto in 2008 to serve as the public distributed ledger for bitcoin cryptocurrency transactions, based on previous work by Stuart Haber, W. Scott Stornetta, and Dave Bayer. The implementation of the blockchain within bitcoin made it the first digital currency to solve the double-spending problem without the need for a trusted authority or central server. The bitcoin design has inspired other applications and blockchains that are readable by the public and are widely used by cryptocurrencies. The blockchain may be considered a type of payment rail.   Ref:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blockchain

62aad607-c43b-4603-8f7e-230b993eaf94.name: Blockchain-Based Food Traceability Implementation
62aad607-c43b-4603-8f7e-230b993eaf94.description:
Blockchain-Based Food Traceability Implementation is the technical skill of designing, developing, and deploying blockchain solutions to enable secure, transparent, and immutable tracking of food products throughout the supply chain. This skill involves integrating distributed ledger technology with existing food production, processing, and distribution systems to record every transaction and movement of food items from origin to consumer. Practitioners must understand blockchain architecture, smart contract development, and data interoperability standards to ensure accurate and tamper-proof records. The skill also requires knowledge of regulatory frameworks such as FSMA (Food Safety Modernization Act) and compliance with global standards like GS1 for traceability. Immediate applications include real-time tracking of produce, rapid identification of contamination sources during recalls, and providing consumers with verifiable information about product origin, handling, and certifications via QR codes or mobile apps. This skill is currently critical for food manufacturers, distributors, and retailers responding to increasing regulatory demands and consumer expectations for transparency, sustainability, and food safety. It also supports operational efficiencies by reducing fraud, streamlining audits, and enhancing supply chain collaboration. Mastery of this skill requires both technical proficiency in blockchain platforms (such as Hyperledger or Ethereum) and domain expertise in food supply chain processes, making it a multidisciplinary capability essential for modern food industry operations.

2de454cd-e145-4301-86b5-660fa7f679e7.name: Board management
2de454cd-e145-4301-86b5-660fa7f679e7.description: Manage board of experts/stakeholders for a organisation or company.

f2862110-27d3-4bff-9290-ca0c48574bec.name: Bootloader
f2862110-27d3-4bff-9290-ca0c48574bec.description: Bootloader is a computer program that ensures an operating system's data is loaded into the main memory during the start-up of a device. Modern automotive cybersecurity through secure communication, strong authentication and flexible firewalls. Embedded Software Implementation.

a01dbb72-69c6-401b-ab36-413d72e2b993.name: Bootstrap
a01dbb72-69c6-401b-ab36-413d72e2b993.description:
Bootstrap (formerly Twitter Bootstrap) is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development. It contains HTML, CSS and (optionally) JavaScript-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation, and other interface components.

As of May 2023, Bootstrap is the 17th most starred project (4th most starred library) on GitHub, with over 164,000 stars. According to W3Techs, Bootstrap is used by 19.2% of all websites.

Features
Bootstrap is an HTML, CSS and JS library that focuses on simplifying the development of informative web pages (as opposed to web applications). The primary purpose of adding it to a web project is to apply Bootstrap's choices of color, size, font and layout to that project. As such, the primary factor is whether the developers in charge find those choices to their liking. Once added to a project, Bootstrap provides basic style definitions for all HTML elements. The result is a uniform appearance for prose, tables and form elements across web browsers. In addition, developers can take advantage of CSS classes defined in Bootstrap to further customize the appearance of their contents. For example, Bootstrap has provisioned for light- and dark-colored tables, page headings, more prominent pull quotes, and text with a highligh  Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bootstrap_(front-end_framework)

c13c2921-23a9-44f8-ac0c-3a074256ccf9.name: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)
c13c2921-23a9-44f8-ac0c-3a074256ccf9.description:
Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) is a standardized exterior gateway protocol designed to exchange routing and reachability information among autonomous systems (AS) on the Internet.[2] BGP is classified as a path-vector routing protocol,[3] and it makes routing decisions based on paths, network policies, or rule-sets configured by a network administrator.

BGP used for routing within an autonomous system is called Interior Border Gateway Protocol (IBGP). In contrast, the Internet application of the protocol is called Exterior Border Gateway Protocol (EBGP).

8f9b5133-cabb-4a83-915d-ffcb53233691.name: Budgeting
8f9b5133-cabb-4a83-915d-ffcb53233691.description: Budgeting is an ongoing activity in which revenues and expenses are managed to maintain fiscal (financial) responsibility and fiscal health. It is the process of planning and controlling future operations by comparing actual results with planned expectations.

efa498ac-b525-4aef-a0fd-dd020619841b.name: Building Information Modeling (BIM)
efa498ac-b525-4aef-a0fd-dd020619841b.description: BIM is an acronym for Building Information Modeling or Building Information Management. It is a highly collaborative process that allows architects, engineers, real estate developers, contractors, manufacturers, and other construction professionals to plan, design, and construct a structure or building within one 3D model.

52e6f311-1fc1-43fc-b6cc-9ec0f4277573.name: Burn-down chart creation
52e6f311-1fc1-43fc-b6cc-9ec0f4277573.description: A burndown chart or burn down chart is a graphical representation of work left to do versus time. The outstanding work is often on the vertical axis, with time along the horizontal. A burn down chart is a run chart of remaining work. It is useful for predicting when all of the work will be completed

f3615c74-9cdd-462c-95dd-b387b3220533.name: Burp Suite
f3615c74-9cdd-462c-95dd-b387b3220533.description: Burp Suite is a software package dedicated to web security audits (web penetration tests). It has been developed by PortSwigger, a leading company in the world of web security.

502c457b-d068-4994-b1c3-fe74d93dd48c.name: Business Architecture
502c457b-d068-4994-b1c3-fe74d93dd48c.description: Business Architecture reveals how an organization is structured and can clearly demonstrate how elements such as capabilities, processes, organization and information fit together. The relationships among the elements dictate and specify what the organization does, and what it needs to do to meet its common goals.

e81d83e3-e688-4a5a-bf8f-bea2f2612f94.name: Business Ethics
e81d83e3-e688-4a5a-bf8f-bea2f2612f94.description: Business ethics is the moral principles, policies, and values that govern the way companies and individuals engage in business activity. It goes beyond legal requirements to establish a code of conduct that drives employee behavior at all levels and helps build trust between a business and its customers.

01972b7a-92eb-4abd-9148-67a551a53bbf.name: Business Process Flows in Dynamics 365
01972b7a-92eb-4abd-9148-67a551a53bbf.description: A Dynamics 365 business process flow is a step-by-step visual guide displayed in the screen header that leads users through an established business process.

dfd49719-1d57-410d-a692-09a203890164.name: Business Process Mapping
dfd49719-1d57-410d-a692-09a203890164.description: Business process mapping is the visual display of the steps within a business process showing how it's done from start to finish. This sort of mapping provides a concise picture of the steps needed to bring a product, service or other process from start to completion and the sequence of steps that must take place.

46d4e433-ea0e-4320-bc78-0d6fb18fa373.name: Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN)
46d4e433-ea0e-4320-bc78-0d6fb18fa373.description: Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) is a flow chart method that models the steps of a planned business process from end to end. A key to Business Process Management, it visually depicts a detailed sequence of business activities and information flows needed to complete a process.

58e9446a-bc4f-46c1-95a2-d3046d68908d.name: Business acumen
58e9446a-bc4f-46c1-95a2-d3046d68908d.description: The ability to understand the market, identify opportunities, and make strategic business decisions that will drive growth and profitability.

ad961bb2-fa32-4e90-8742-99a8c5be643f.name: Business analysis
ad961bb2-fa32-4e90-8742-99a8c5be643f.description: Business analysis is a professional discipline[1] focussed on identifying business needs and determining solutions to business problems. Solutions may include a software-systems development component, process improvements, or organizational changes, and may involve extensive analysis, strategic planning and policy development. A person dedicated to carrying out these tasks within an organization is called a business analyst or BA

bc0461d7-aa2a-42a7-b785-d6a563689c35.name: Business development
bc0461d7-aa2a-42a7-b785-d6a563689c35.description: Business development entails tasks and processes to develop and implement growth opportunities within and between organizations.[1] It is a subset of the fields of business, commerce and organizational theory. Business development is the creation of long-term value for an organization from customers, markets, and relationships.[2] Business development can be taken to mean any activity by either a small or large organization, non-profit or for-profit enterprise which serves the purpose of ‘developing’ the business in some way. In addition, business development activities can be done internally or externally by a business development consultant. External business development can be facilitated through Planning Systems, which are put in place by governments to help small businesses. In addition, reputation building has also proven to help facilitate business development.

2d30a73a-c956-47f7-8262-21caadefcfcf.name: Business innovation
2d30a73a-c956-47f7-8262-21caadefcfcf.description: Business innovation refers to the process of introducing new ideas, methods, products, or services that result in significant improvements or advancements within an organization.

7906b8dc-72b8-4cd5-ac88-60718ab7ac93.name: Business intelligence
7906b8dc-72b8-4cd5-ac88-60718ab7ac93.description: Business intelligence (BI) comprises the strategies and technologies used by enterprises for the data analysis and management of business information. Common functions of business intelligence technologies include reporting, online analytical processing, analytics, dashboard development, data mining, process mining, complex event processing, business performance management, benchmarking, text mining, predictive analytics, and prescriptive analytics

63cff106-c2b4-4ad4-b043-fbb90a047e76.name: Business management
63cff106-c2b4-4ad4-b043-fbb90a047e76.description: Business management is the coordination and organization of business activities. Business managers oversee operations and help employees reach their top productivity levels. A business manager may also supervise or train new employees, help a business reach its operational and financial objectives.

05a10e1e-0866-415e-9200-6fc2a121e5cd.name: Business ownership
05a10e1e-0866-415e-9200-6fc2a121e5cd.description: Business ownership is in it's simplest form to own shares in a company, but it needs to be managed and nurtured and followed up to make the investment grow.

f9bac6a6-a612-46e9-a000-e1d8771be28d.name: Business planning
f9bac6a6-a612-46e9-a000-e1d8771be28d.description: Business planning is developing a company's mission or goals and defining the strategies you will use to achieve those goals or tasks. The process can be extensive, encompassing all aspects of the operation, or it can be concrete, focusing on specific functions within the overall corporate structure.

b54c920f-697a-487f-8f60-b3cc74b2f4c7.name: Business process management (BPM)
b54c920f-697a-487f-8f60-b3cc74b2f4c7.description: Business process management (BPM) is a discipline that uses various methods to discover, model, analyze, measure, improve and optimize business processes. A business process coordinates the behavior of people, systems, information and things to produce business outcomes in support of a business strategy.

12388e40-cc8f-45c2-930d-c00acedf8e35.name: Business process re-engineering
12388e40-cc8f-45c2-930d-c00acedf8e35.description: Business process re-engineering (BPR) is a business management strategy originally pioneered in the early 1990s, focusing on the analysis and design of workflows and business processes within an organization. BPR aims to help organizations fundamentally rethink how they do their work in order to improve customer service, cut operational costs, and become world-class competitors

0da3ed49-28ca-43a6-a43e-9466c9ad2c0a.name: Business strategy
0da3ed49-28ca-43a6-a43e-9466c9ad2c0a.description: The process of definining and executing a business strategy

d5989d89-13f1-42c0-9f16-cc1a09bb8892.name: Business valuation
d5989d89-13f1-42c0-9f16-cc1a09bb8892.description: A business valuation, also known as a company valuation, is the process of determining the economic value of a business. During the valuation process, all areas of a business are analyzed to determine its worth and the worth of its departments or units.

c47041aa-c385-47c6-9186-ba053dfd742e.name: Buyer Persona-Based Content Development
c47041aa-c385-47c6-9186-ba053dfd742e.description:
Buyer Persona-Based Content Development is a specialized creative skill focused on crafting tailored content that resonates with specific buyer personas at various stages of the sales funnel. This skill requires a deep understanding of target audiences, including their demographics, motivations, pain points, and decision-making behaviors. By leveraging detailed persona profiles, content creators can develop messaging, formats, and narratives that speak directly to the needs and interests of each segment, increasing engagement and conversion rates. In the current digital landscape, where personalization and relevance are critical to capturing attention, this skill is essential for marketers, copywriters, and creative strategists aiming to drive measurable business outcomes. Typical applications include developing blog posts, email campaigns, landing pages, case studies, and social media content that align with the buyer’s journey—from awareness to consideration and decision. Practitioners must integrate research, empathy, and storytelling to ensure content not only informs but also persuades and builds trust. The process often involves collaboration with sales and marketing teams to refine personas and map content to sales stages, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Mastery of this skill results in more effective sales enablement materials, higher lead quality, and improved ROI on content marketing efforts, making it a cornerstone of modern creative strategy.

1f6fedb7-be9e-4ed4-9372-b3d0f6e98142.name: Buying Center Analysis
1f6fedb7-be9e-4ed4-9372-b3d0f6e98142.description:
Buying Center Analysis is the systematic identification, mapping, and evaluation of all individuals and roles involved in an organization's purchasing decision for complex sales. In today's business environment, purchasing decisions—especially for high-value or strategic products and services—are rarely made by a single individual. Instead, they involve a 'buying center,' a group of stakeholders with varying levels of influence, authority, and interest. This skill requires the ability to discern and categorize key roles such as initiators, users, influencers, gatekeepers, deciders, and buyers, each of whom may have different priorities, concerns, and decision criteria. Practitioners of Buying Center Analysis must gather and synthesize information from organizational charts, internal communications, and stakeholder interviews to build a comprehensive map of the decision-making unit. This enables sales professionals, account managers, and business strategists to tailor their engagement strategies, address specific stakeholder needs, and anticipate objections or roadblocks. The skill is crucial for navigating complex B2B sales cycles, shortening sales timelines, and increasing win rates by ensuring that all relevant parties are engaged and their concerns addressed. In the current business landscape, where remote work, cross-functional teams, and matrix organizations are common, Buying Center Analysis is more important than ever for understanding organizational dynamics and driving successful outcomes in enterprise sales and procurement processes.

Domain: Business Strategy
Domain Description: Strategic planning, market analysis, and business development
Skill Type: Knowledge Based
Skill Areas: Organizational, Technical, Process
Relevance Score: 1.2

In the current business landscape, where remote work, cross-functional teams, and matrix organizations are common, Buying Center Analysis is more important than ever for understanding organizational dynamics and driving successful outcomes in enterprise sales and procurement processes.

a3446cf8-86f5-41ea-8bde-36e5d05fb764.name: CIS Benchmarks
a3446cf8-86f5-41ea-8bde-36e5d05fb764.description: CIS Benchmarks from the Center for Internet Security (CIS) are a set of globally recognized and consensus-driven best practices to help security practitioners implement and manage their cybersecurity defenses.

69b90b54-d914-4ea1-aa00-fc8e33516625.name: CI/CD
69b90b54-d914-4ea1-aa00-fc8e33516625.description: CI/CD is a way of developing software in which you're able to release updates at any time in a sustainable way. When changing code is routine, development cycles are more frequent, meaningful and faster. “CI/CD” stands for the combined practices of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD).

8ad6096b-3d2e-4c26-a172-16b495a8497d.name: COBOL
8ad6096b-3d2e-4c26-a172-16b495a8497d.description: COBOL (/ˈkoʊbɒl, -bɔːl/; an acronym for "common business-oriented language") is a compiled English-like computer programming language designed for business use. It is an imperative, procedural and, since 2002, object-oriented language. COBOL is primarily used in business, finance, and administrative systems for companies and governments. COBOL is still widely used in applications deployed on mainframe computers, such as large-scale batch and transaction processing jobs. Many large financial institutions were developing new systems in the language as late as 2006, but most programming in COBOL today is purely to maintain existing applications. Programs are being moved to new platforms, rewritten in modern languages or replaced with other software.  Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COBOL

335ae8a9-7cf9-4865-9dba-87178380b389.name: CORBA
335ae8a9-7cf9-4865-9dba-87178380b389.description: CORBA is a standard for distributing objects across networks so that operations on those objects can be called remotely. CORBA is not associated with a particular programming language, and any language with a CORBA binding can be used to call and implement CORBA objects.

ebc11789-f6cf-4cf6-91c6-8e84c40b29cf.name: Capital budgeting
ebc11789-f6cf-4cf6-91c6-8e84c40b29cf.description: Capital budgeting is a process that businesses use to evaluate potential major projects or investments. Building a new plant or taking a large stake in an outside venture are examples of initiatives that typically require capital budgeting before they are approved or rejected by management.

3947fd15-16ee-4dff-9b58-6aabbdbd4d30.name: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)
3947fd15-16ee-4dff-9b58-6aabbdbd4d30.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML (including XML dialects such as SVG, MathML or XHTML). CSS describes how elements should be rendered on screen, on paper, in speech, or on other media.

65fdb2d9-74d5-463e-875a-bd78aaac8ad5.name: Chairman/manager of the board
65fdb2d9-74d5-463e-875a-bd78aaac8ad5.description: The chairman or manager of a board of an organisation or business.

db572c78-0d41-4224-bd65-93f332826c2e.name: Change Management for Digital Transformation in Food Systems
db572c78-0d41-4224-bd65-93f332826c2e.name_en: Change Management for Digital Transformation in Food Systems
db572c78-0d41-4224-bd65-93f332826c2e.description:
Change Management for Digital Transformation in Food Systems is a critical leadership skill focused on guiding organizations within the food sector through the complex process of adopting digital technologies and innovations. This skill involves orchestrating organizational change to ensure the successful integration of digital tools such as precision agriculture platforms, supply chain traceability systems, data analytics, and automation technologies. Leaders proficient in this area are adept at assessing organizational readiness, communicating the vision and benefits of digital transformation, and addressing resistance among diverse stakeholders including farmers, processors, distributors, and regulators. They foster a culture of adaptability and continuous learning, ensuring that staff at all levels are engaged and empowered throughout the transformation journey. Effective change management in this context requires a nuanced understanding of the unique challenges in food systems, such as food safety regulations, sustainability goals, and the need for transparent supply chains. Leaders must also coordinate cross-functional teams, manage risks associated with technology adoption, and measure progress against clearly defined objectives. In today's rapidly evolving food industry, this skill is essential for organizations seeking to remain competitive, resilient, and responsive to market demands and regulatory pressures. Typical use cases include leading the rollout of digital traceability solutions, implementing farm management software, or transitioning to data-driven decision-making processes. Mastery of this skill ensures that digital transformation initiatives deliver their intended value and are embraced by all stakeholders.

b49111f8-ab48-4299-86dc-580c7672dac8.description:
Change Management for Sales Teams is a critical leadership skill focused on guiding sales professionals through organizational, technological, and process transformations in today's rapidly evolving enterprise sales environments. This skill involves the ability to anticipate, plan for, communicate, and implement changes that impact sales strategies, structures, tools, and customer engagement models. Leaders proficient in this area understand the unique challenges faced by sales teams, such as adapting to new CRM systems, shifting go-to-market strategies, integrating digital sales tools, or responding to changes in buyer behavior and market dynamics. Effective change management for sales teams requires a blend of strategic vision and practical execution, including stakeholder engagement, transparent communication, training and upskilling, and ongoing support to minimize resistance and maximize adoption. It also involves monitoring progress, gathering feedback, and making iterative adjustments to ensure the change delivers intended business outcomes, such as increased sales effectiveness, improved customer relationships, and sustained revenue growth. In the current business climate, where agility and adaptability are paramount, this skill is essential for sales leaders and managers who must foster a culture of resilience, maintain team motivation, and ensure alignment with broader organizational objectives. Typical use cases include leading the adoption of new sales methodologies, integrating sales teams post-merger, or rolling out new incentive structures.

f37790e2-863e-4721-a389-f9174eb19cc7.name: Change Management
f37790e2-863e-4721-a389-f9174eb19cc7.description: Change management (sometimes abbreviated as CM) is a collective term for all approaches to prepare, support, and help individuals, teams, and organizations in making organizational change. It includes methods that redirect or redefine the use of resources, business process, budget allocations, or other modes of operation that significantly change a company or organization.

9438b64d-ddbe-40db-a219-e485256d26d1.name: Change facilitator
9438b64d-ddbe-40db-a219-e485256d26d1.description: A change facilitator is someone who helps employees adapt to new conditions by ensuring that employees understand the reasons for change, the benefits that result, and the steps required to transition or transform to the new state. They help managers identify options, communicate clearly, and resolve conflicts. Facilitation is the key to ensuring people understand the change, participate successfully to create the desired future, and accept that the real change requires changes in their own thoughts, attitudes, and behaviors.

9ca4b063-b56f-4c03-8ff2-84422bdf679b.name: ChatGPT
9ca4b063-b56f-4c03-8ff2-84422bdf679b.description: ChatGPT, which stands for Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer, is a large language model-based chatbot developed by OpenAI and launched on November 30, 2022, which enables users to refine and steer a conversation towards a desired length, format, style, level of detail, and language. Successive prompts and replies, known as prompt engineering, are considered at each conversation stage as a context.[

a168d5b8-64de-49a5-8ad4-4d4e38fb8bf1.name: Check Point Intrusion Prevention System (IPS)
a168d5b8-64de-49a5-8ad4-4d4e38fb8bf1.description: Check Point Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) provides complete, integrated, next generation firewall intrusion prevention capabilities at multi-gigabit speeds with high security effectiveness and a low false positive rate. IPS protections in our Next Generation Firewall are updated automatically.

59ad77b0-7453-4be1-84fd-53d45fb69650.name: Circular Economy Practices in Food Logistics
59ad77b0-7453-4be1-84fd-53d45fb69650.name_en: Circular Economy Practices in Food Logistics
59ad77b0-7453-4be1-84fd-53d45fb69650.description:
Circular Economy Practices in Food Logistics refers to the application of circular economy principles—such as resource efficiency, waste minimization, and closed-loop systems—within the logistics processes of the food industry. This skill involves designing, implementing, and managing logistics strategies that prioritize the reduction, reuse, and recycling of materials and products throughout the food supply chain. Practitioners leverage knowledge of sustainable packaging, reverse logistics, surplus food redistribution, and by-product valorization to minimize landfill waste and environmental impact. Immediate applications include optimizing transportation routes to reduce carbon emissions, collaborating with suppliers and retailers to recover unsold or surplus food for redistribution or upcycling, and integrating digital tracking systems to monitor resource flows and identify inefficiencies. This skill is crucial for businesses seeking to comply with current regulations on food waste and sustainability, meet consumer demand for environmentally responsible practices, and achieve cost savings through resource optimization. It also supports corporate social responsibility goals and enhances brand reputation. In today’s business environment, where sustainability is a competitive differentiator and regulatory requirements are tightening, expertise in Circular Economy Practices in Food Logistics is essential for maintaining operational resilience, reducing costs, and contributing to a more sustainable food system.
